channel.title: Nature Communications
channel.description:
Nature Communications is an open access, multidisciplinary journal dedicated to publishing high-quality research in all areas of the biological, health, physical, chemical and Earth sciences. Papers published by the journal aim to represent important advances of significance to specialists within each field.

We are committed to providing an efficient service for both authors and readers. Our team of independent editors make rapid and fair publication decisions. Prompt dissemination of accepted papers to a wide readership and beyond is achieved through a programme of continuous online publication.

item.title: Evidence for single variant in altermagnetic RuO<sub>2</sub>(101) thin films
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 24 September 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-63344-y

Altermagnetism arises from a combination of crystal symmetry and magnetic ordering. For the altermagnetic properties to be clear, and technologically useful, the same crystal variant must be present over the entire sample. Here, He, Wen and coauthors achieve such single variant thin films in RuO2, confirming the altermagnetic properties via XMLD and transport measurements.
item.dc:title: Evidence for single variant in altermagnetic RuO<sub>2</sub>(101) thin films
item.dc:creator: Cong He
Zhenchao Wen
Jun Okabayashi
